definition: Taiqian county in Puyang 濮陽|濮阳[Pu2 yang2], Henan
front/forward/ahead/first/top (followed by a number)/future/ago/before/BC (e.g. 前293年)/former/formerly
Taiqian county in Puyang 濮陽|濮阳[Pu2 yang2], Henan

sentences.english: Concentrate on those who have bought drinks and are still loitering at the bar.
sentences.chinese: 注意那些已经买了酒可还在吧台前晃荡的人。

sentences.english: Gentlemen, how did it seem to you, to go, in front?
sentences.chinese: 先生们，你们在台前观戏，感觉怎样？

sentences.english: You will feel a need to bring things out into the open, more than ever.
sentences.chinese: 你会感到把事情带到台前的需要，超出以往任何时候。

sentences.english: Oh that I knew where I might find him! that I might come even to his seat!
sentences.chinese: 惟愿我能知道在那里可以寻见神，能到他的台前。

sentences.english: For we shall all stand before the judgment seat of Christ.
sentences.chinese: 因为我们都要站在基督的审判台前。

sentences.english: For this very purpose a platoon of soldiers is drafted in to protect the senior monks sitting on the plinth.
sentences.chinese: 为此，一排士兵站在方台前保护高级僧侣们。

sentences.english: She said he walked into the police station and then he collapsed at the custody desk.
sentences.chinese: 她说他走进警局，然后就在拘留手续台前瘫倒在地。

sentences.english: for we shall all stand before the judgment seat of Christ.
sentences.chinese: 因为我们都要站在神的台前。

sentences.english: IV. Our works will be judged at Christ's Bema.
sentences.chinese: 我们的工作与人生要在主台前受审判。

sentences.english: On the Impact of Vietnam War on American Economy;
sentences.chinese: 美苏两强一个台前，一个幕后都卷入了越南战争。

sentences.english: She was murdered by right-wing vigilantes before the Nazis officially assumed power.
sentences.chinese: 她在希特勒正式上台前被右翼行动队谋杀。

sentences.english: Both two powers U S and USSR were involved in the Vietnamese War directly or indirectly.
sentences.chinese: 美苏两强一个台前，一个幕后都卷入了越南战争。

sentences.english: I can see you now: sitting at your desk by lamplight, alone on a Saturday night.
sentences.chinese: 我看见了你，周六独自在台前挑灯夜读。

sentences.english: Bartiromo is known for her hard work, on-screen and off.
sentences.chinese: 巴蒂罗姆因其在台前幕后的努力工作而闻名。

sentences.english: Liverpool can go for a win in front of the Kop .
sentences.chinese: 利物浦也可以在考普看台前争取一场胜利。

sentences.english: He walked to the front of the stage and began to harangue the audience.
sentences.chinese: 他走到台前，开始对听众慷慨陈辞。

definition: stage/proscenium/foreground in politics etc (sometimes derog.)/front desk/reception desk/(computing) front-end/foreground
to rise to power (in politics)/to go on stage (in the theater)
woven mat/seat/banquet/place in a democratic assembly/classifier for banquets, conversations etc
(of the people in a group) to get into position (idiom)/(athletics) On your mark!
meeting place/place where people gather/CL:個|个[ge4]
(of an actor, athlete etc) to prepare to make one's entrance/to wait in the wings
to sit down/to take a seat
